author: franciscop
title: AdaTickr-Track Your ADAcrypto Price
description: Track your ADA crypto prices with an Open Source and simplified display, away from your computer and phone. You can track other Cryptos too!

f6_assessments.q0:
I believe this is the proper challenge category for this proposal, but it seems that the proposal doesn't pertain to the Cardano ecosystem anymore than it does to another coin's ecosystem. 

Based on the description of the product, it provides price data for a variety of currencies, rather than focusing on Cardano ecosystem data.  Other than the name of the product, it doesn't specifically provide any features for the Cardano ecosystem. 

One idea to make this product more specific to Cardano would be interacting with wallet data (pool.pm?) to display CNFTs or Cardano specific news, blog posts, updates from the web.
f6_assessments.q1:
Given the experience of the project lead, I have no doubts that this product would be implemented successfully and completed in the timeframe listed (4 months). Javier has many years of experience in the field and according to the proposal, the team has many years of experience as well.
The budget listed($50,600) seems reasonable for 4 people to develop the product over 4 months time.
It is outside of my knowledge the requirements necessary to scale production and supply chain issues which was mentioned as a possible challenge.
The product lists 3 features(sound alert, light indicator, display) but doesn't suggest general features such as: Color display? Rechargeable battery? Size? Customizability of features?
I think more details about the product, and how it is woven into the Cardano ecosystem would be helpful.
f6_assessments.q2:
Photos have been shared which demonstrate the display showing price data, which is great.  In the comments, the proposer mentions this would be an open source coded project available for viewing on GitHub to keep up with any updates moving forward with the project.
Given that this is a physical product being produced, I think it would be helpful to see more photos or graphics showing design to give the voter a more complete picture of what the intended product idea is(physically).
f6_assessments.reply: We like to elaborate on the point of why other Crypto is included and how this will value add to the Cardano community. f6_assessments.q0: The proposal aims to create a ticker - a device that displays the price change of a set trading pair (e.g. ADA/USDT). The proposer find the problem that phones, computers are a second nature, and that somehow there is a risk that you will miss the price change. Well, let me argue - most of apps on phone are having notifications which you can set, e.g. if the price increases/decreases about set %, a sound and visual notification is raised on your device (lets say a phone). So, from this perspective, I am not really convinced that you have managed to identify a problem that needs to be solved, and at the same time, whether it will be just another device that will not find its demand. Also, in the proposal is stated, that when this ticker will be at hand, that people will be less distracted, but I would claim otherwise - having crypto displayed 24/7 will take more of your attention, therefore unless you are a scalper or daytrader, you will not find use for it, and if you are daytrader/scalper, you are already having your "workstation and devices" ready to use.
f6_assessments.q1: Regarding feasibility, the ticker itself, based on the description seems quite easy to implement, thus the budget is more than required - it does not decreases feasibility. Also the timeline is already appearing larger than required - it does not decrease feasibility either. The team seems to have sufficient experience and skill, and the linked in of the team leader is posted. What to improve? The roadmap could have been provided in a more detail, to provide that there was some plan behind e.g. 3 months of software engineering. Also, another thing to improve - you plan to run 1000 devices at the end of the timeline, but there is no mention about costs of such device (even expectation),, and right now, it is unclear whether the budget asked is only to develop one device, or it also includes 1k devices built.
f6_assessments.q2:
Auditability of software will be able to be performed via shared gitHub repo - but there is no mention about auditability of HW progress - whether it will be shared via some social media, or discord/telegram, or some weekly/bi-weekly reports are planned. 

Success is described as one functional device, or lets say a working product. Yes, we can definitely assess the success (partially) on a working device, but what about the problem solution? - people are missing some movements on the market? If this was the problem you wanted to solve, I am not really sure if a working device is a success metric (to the full extent) and there should be some metric evaluating e.g. people are less distracted, or, people did not miss price movements - but we all agree that it is most likely impossible to measure, therefore I think that auditabiity of the success, which should be related to "problem vs solution" is not really possible.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is one that is fun and interesting, but it doesn't provide any meaningful impact or change for people that are already involved in Crypto.  This might also promote bad behaviors in terms of constant awareness of price movements.
f6_assessments.q1: The team appears to have sufficient skill to be able to develop and create the product that they are describing in the proposal.   The only question/doubt might be concerning sourcing hardware given supply chain shortages.

f6_assessments.q0: It is certainly a very interesting idea that deserves attention. I believe that the proposal is in line with the challenge, because the creation of this specific device to capture information about Ada (such as market share value and price variation, for example) is not something that fits with any other challenge. This device would allow the ada holder to have much more control over how he will use his cryptocurrencies, as he will be informed in practically real time about the changes and will also be able to moderate the device in his own way (for example, pasting a price alert that will indicate when Ada reaches a certain pre-chosen value). In my opinion, this project may also be an attraction for new Ada holders. As far as I know, no cryptocurrency has such a device, and as we know the nature of cryptocurrencies is highly soluble, so it is super valid that one of them (Ada) has a faster and safer way of control. Therefore, I think that the proposal has the potential to generate an extreme impact for Cardano, deserving top marks in this regard.
f6_assessments.q1: The project seems viable to me, although it could have been better detailed in some points. For example, in the script, the proponent says what would happen according to a certain time interval (1 month, 2 months...) but he does not explain the activities, he only mentions them. With this, we have a somewhat superficial understanding of the whole. Regarding the use of funding, similarly, we know in general how the borrowed money would be used, but so much specificity is passed down. For example, we don't know how long the engineers involved would work (a full day's work? half a day?). The amount is broken down into parts, but they could be more detailed. The team presentation is the best part here. We know good details about each stakeholder, which conveys confidence in their abilities to make this project happen. In summary, I think the topic is good, but not ideal.
f6_assessments.q2: This was the part that left a lot to be desired. The author of the proposal does not explore much how the project can be audited. It says it will post updates on github. But what will be posted and how often? How can the Cardano community be aware of the posts? Where will they be notified? And speaking of success, he reaffirms what is said in the impact part, the bigger goal here is to make it simpler and more straightforward for the Cardano community to keep up with the price of Ada without compromising mental health. I'm sure the goal is noble and will do a lot of good for community members, however, it would be interesting for the author to plot metrics on how the project affected the growth of our currency, transactions on the Cardano blockchain (grew?) and so on. So I think this part could still improve a lot.

f6_assessments.q0: I don’t see this proposal fitting in any other challenge and it is related to Cardano which makes it a good candidate for the miscellaneous challenge. The proponents want to create a device that displays Ada and other cryptocurrencies prices in real time. According to the proponent this will solve the problem of always having to check the computer or the phone to get the price information. Right now I can’t picture the impact that this will have on the Cardano ecosystem, so I will not give this a 5 rating. I suggest to the proponents to find strong benefits of the device for the Cardano community. Maybe the device can include other information that should be useful to the community. As it’s presented at the moment, I would not buy this device. For that reason I give it a 4 rating.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal contains enough details on its execution that makes believe in its successful implementation. They have provided a timeline to complete the work which should be in 3 to 4 months according to the calculation. I have to say that the timeline is not well presented and can be confusing. I recommend to the proponents to create a better and easy to read roadmap. The budget however, is well formatted and broken down into identifiable items. I feel like the budget can be reasonable based solely on intuition. As a digital marketer, I’m not knowledgeable about the price of electronic components. Besides, the team seems solid and they have included the link to the linkedin profile page of one of the team members. Altogether, I have confidence in a successful implementation of this proposal based on all the information included.
f6_assessments.q2: Since this is a device and we know how the finish should look like, tracking the progress of the project shouldn’t be hard. However I suggest to the proponents to add a detailed roadmap with milestones and timeline for achievement. I know that they have added a timeline for milestones but it’s confusing and can be improved. Moreover they have added metrics/KPis such as weekly github reports which will show the development activities of the project. Altogether, I think that the project should be auditable, although they should improve the roadmap and timeline.

f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has the relevant skills and experience to implement the project. The resources and tools needed are fairly straight forward since the device are fairly simple. The proposer did not specify how they will create the software such as what language that will be used to code the program, is it python? What about the API and what will be the source of the crypto price? The budget requested are high for a simple project. The team identifies a risk associated with supply chain, but the more concerning issue here is competitors. What will be the strong attraction point to sell this product? Does your product design aiming for the decoration niche instead to compete with other gadgets? With the above argument, I rate the feasibility score of 2

f6_assessments.q0:
The images provided by the proposers show a product of a very nice design that I would not mind having on my desk.  Without the details of its manufacture (details corresponding to the display of the images attached) I could risk to affirm that it is a product well thought for the purpose suggested by the proposers.  However, although it is not made clear why it is shown, through the attached images, an apparently functional product while in the Feasability section design, prototyping and testing activities are described (although what the images may be showing is simply a sample of how the final product would look like, which would explain why the display shows a quote that ADAEUR has never been in since its introduction to the public market), the following are the reasons why the suggested product proposition is not feasible (please note that I am not stating "it is my opinion", or "I believe", since it is not my opinion that I am stating here, they are just facts):

the service that the proponents wish to provide through their product is already available through online platforms, in real time, tick-by-tick, easily accessible through mobile phones and any other screen the user wants to employ, with the same functionalities that the proponents describe: price alerts with sounds, a wide range of pairs, a wide range of timeframes, and many other features, like alerts sent by mail, etc.  However, the important thing to keep in mind here is that the companies developing these platforms have taken the game of displaying market information to stratospheric levels, utilizing infrastructure and talent that can only be paid for with massive amounts of private capital, because their core business of those companies, their lifeblood, their very existence, is defined by the display of real-time, tick-by-tick information.  Love it or hate it, you can't help but recognize two things: 1) they have done an impeccable job at the informational level (from anywhere on the planet the user can access information in an efficient way, in real time, tick-by-tick) and at the graphical level (the interfaces are increasingly attractive and adaptable to the user's tastes and needs);  2) as in the HFT (High Frequency Trading) business, the beneficiary is the user, since the companies competing in the market information display sector are willing to stab each other in order to squeeze pennies, therefore, the user can not only choose his provider, he can do it at increasingly competitive prices, even for free.
    
And free is the concept that corresponds to us as non-professional consumers of market information.  We are in a position to enjoy the gigantic technical and financial investment made by the private sector, for free.  It's like being able to enjoy for less than $10 bucks a Hollywood blockbuster that cost billions of dollars to make, but better, because as users who don't require complex features at our disposal, it's free.    

In summary, and I don't want to sound cruel, but the reality is that today, anyone can have access to the information and features described in the proposal, with fantastic interfaces, in real time, tick-by-tick, and at no cost.  The best of the best, put at the user's fingertips, at no cost. But I can tell you with complete certainty: the proponents' intention of wanting to provide access to information is good, they just want to get into a game that has been in rotation for decades (see, for ex, www.tradingview.com).   


You, Mr. and Mrs. user, do not want that madness on your desk. Unless you are a professional trader, who lives behind every tick of price movement, who needs to have your finger on the pulse of something that is ultimately not in your control, let me tell you: you do not want this torture in your life.  Not even the producers of grains, food, commodities in general, want that in their lives: they hire financial entities (banks, hedge funds, etc.) to be the ones to carry out the hedging operations, so that they are the ones to deal with that madness (and as the premiums paid are considerable, the financial entities do the job without any problem).  

The same proposal makes mention of the madness I am talking about when it states: "There can be a big jump any second, and you just can't afford to miss it. Checking your phone has become second nature. Almost every free moment you have is used to check your ADA crypto. At work, at home, even on your commute. It can get overwhelming, and become an unhealthy obsession."  With access only through the phone, you ensure your peace of mind.  

My recommendation to proponents, voters and members of the community at large: there is nothing you can do to control volatility.  It is almost a natural phenomenon (you don't tell the rain what to do).  However, maybe this is the right time to start learning about hedging and personal treasury management: take your ADAs, lock it and borrow Djed (stable coin) againts it. That's how it's done in the real world.
f6_assessments.q1:
The skills of the team members seem solid, i.e., on a technical level they seem to know what they are talking about.  In addition to my concerns expressed in the Impact section, I find confusion in relating the amounts of money specified in the budget to the total budget requested.

On the other hand, although in the subsection "What does success for this project look like?" of the Auditability section it is clearly stated: "We seek the Cardano Community support to develop this product. Once successful, we will perform a trial production of 1,000 pieces and the first 1,000 users in the community can order this gadget at Cost + Shipment", that clarification of production not included in the proposal is not made in the Roadmap and in the budget.  That is, in the Feasability section the proposers should make it clear that the activity "1 Month - Production Run for the first 1,000 pieces" included in the Roadmap is not covered by the requested budget. 

Finally, the requested budget ($50600 USD) amounts to a significant percentage of the total budget allocated to the Challenge (10%). In view of the arguments I have presented in the impact section, I believe that the voters should reflect carefully on the appropriateness of this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: Proposers do not provide KPIs that allow efficient monitoring of the implementation and progress of their proposal.  The suggested KPI "We will update every week our repositories in GITHUB" does not allow a responsible and strategic control of the proposal.
